condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2016, social services promoting social well-being of children by addressing identified deprivations and by improving supply, quality demand and enabling environment in Stann Creek, Belize and Toledo Districts

description.narrative: Success in key developmental initiatives were prioritized through advocacy, empowerment and by strengthening the capabilities of partners in ensuring provision of quality social services in early childhood development and education. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2017

title.narrative: Number of Student support service unit by district.
b2a. Availability, in schools supported by UNICEF, of quality CFS/CFE standards that are consistent with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) ) Schools at which WASH facilities have been installed in the reporting year only, with UNICEF direct support
Proportion of schools adequate soap and toilet paper to meet the demands for hand-washing.
Proportion of the schools with the number of functioning water and sanitation facility that meets international standards.

baseline.value: Belize City-20%, Stann Creek-13%, Toledo-32 % (WASH Survey 2011)

title.narrative: ECD policy and strategic plan submitted to Cabinet for ratification and implementation
Revised Handbook of Policies and Procedure for School
Percentage of primary school teacher with full teaching license.

baseline.value: Stann Creek: 75%, Toledo: 75%, Belize City southside:75%

title.narrative: Existence of a national education strategy/plan that promote equity in terms of access and learning
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of policies on inclusive ECD covering particularly children with disabilities and other marginalized children
Percentage of identified children with Special Needs (SEN) formally referred and placed in schools.
Number of secondary schools in South side Belize City, Stann Creek and Toledo with access to support services.
Percentage of school rated satisfactory and above against national school performance standard (National Quality School Framework)
